Package us.daveread.edu.graphics.tool

Interface PenInterface

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    Pen
    public interface PenInterface

    • Method Detail

      • setColor

        void setColor​(java.awt.Color currentColor)
        Sets the current pen color.
        Parameters:
        currentColor - The color for the pen

      • drawTo

        void drawTo​(java.awt.Point location)
        Draw a line from the current pen location to the supplied point.
        Parameters:
        location - The ending location for the line

      • drawTo

        void drawTo​(int x,
            int y)
        Draw a line from the current pen location to the supplied point.
        Parameters:
        x - The ending x location
        y - The ending y location

      • moveTo

        void moveTo​(java.awt.Point location)
        Move the pen's current location to the supplied point without drawing.
        Parameters:
        location - The new starting location for the pen

      • moveTo

        void moveTo​(int x,
            int y)
        Move the pen's current location to the supplied point without drawing.
        Parameters:
        x - The new starting x location for the pen
        y - The new starting y location for the pen

      • changeDirection

        void changeDirection​(int adjustAngleDegrees)
        Change the drawing direction for the pen based on the current drawing direction.
        Parameters:
        adjustAngleDegrees - The adjustment to the drawing angle in degrees. Positive values change the direction clockwise, negative values chance the direction counter-clockwise.

      • setDirection

        void setDirection​(int angleDegrees)
        Set the drawing direction for the pen.
        Parameters:
        angleDegrees - The direction or drawing based on a 360 degree circle. 270 degrees is up (north). 0 degrees is right (east)

      • draw

        void draw​(int distance)
        Draw a line of the supplied length in the current direction.
        Parameters:
        distance - The length of the line in pixels

      • drawText

        void drawText​(java.lang.String message)
        Draw text on the drawing surface. The current location is NOT changed.
        Parameters:
        message - The text to write

      • move

        void move​(int distance)
        Move the pen's current location along a line of the supplied distance in the current direction.
        Parameters:
        distance - The distance to move the pen in pixels

      • getCurrentLocation

        java.awt.Point getCurrentLocation()
        Get the current location of the pen
        Returns:
        The current location

      • getCurrentDirection

        int getCurrentDirection()
        Get the current direction the pen will move
        Returns:
        The current direction for drawing

      • getDrawingSurface

        DrawingSurface getDrawingSurface()
        The drawing surface associated with this pen
        Returns:
        The drawing surface
